trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Evaluating and Installing Microsoft Rights Management sharing application

trans-unit.source: This section explains what Microsoft Rights Management sharing application is and how to install it:
trans-unit.target: This section explains what Microsoft Rights Management sharing application is and how to install it:

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>What is the Microsoft Rights Management sharing application?</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>What is the Microsoft Rights Management sharing application?</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>What is the Microsoft Rights Management sharing application?
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>What is the Microsoft Rights Management sharing application?

trans-unit.source: Microsoft Rights Management sharing application is an optional downloadable application for Microsoft Windows that provides the following:
trans-unit.target: Microsoft Rights Management sharing application is an optional downloadable application for Microsoft Windows that provides the following:

trans-unit.source: Enhances File Explorer (also known as Windows Explorer in Windows 7 and earlier versions) to allow you to protect a single file, or bulk protect multiple files as well as all files within a selected folder.
trans-unit.target: Enhances File Explorer (also known as Windows Explorer in Windows 7 and earlier versions) to allow you to protect a single file, or bulk protect multiple files as well as all files within a selected folder.

trans-unit.source: Adds support for protection of any type of file and a built-in viewer for commonly used text and image file types.
trans-unit.target: Adds support for protection of any type of file and a built-in viewer for commonly used text and image file types.

trans-unit.source: Adds new buttons to the Microsoft Office toolbar for Word, PowerPoint, and Excel.
trans-unit.target: Adds new buttons to the Microsoft Office toolbar for Word, PowerPoint, and Excel.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Requirements for Microsoft Rights Management sharing application
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Requirements for Microsoft Rights Management sharing application

trans-unit.source: To use the Microsoft Rights Management sharing application, your computer must be running Windows 8.1, Windows 8, or Windows 7.
trans-unit.target: To use the Microsoft Rights Management sharing application, your computer must be running Windows 8.1, Windows 8, or Windows 7.

trans-unit.source: The Microsoft Rights Management sharing application requires the AD RMS Client 2.1, which is installed as part of the installation package.
trans-unit.target: The Microsoft Rights Management sharing application requires the AD RMS Client 2.1, which is installed as part of the installation package.

trans-unit.source: The Microsoft Rights Management sharing application will only work with this version of the AD RMS client.
trans-unit.target: The Microsoft Rights Management sharing application will only work with this version of the AD RMS client.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Installing the Microsoft Rights Management sharing application
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Installing the Microsoft Rights Management sharing application

trans-unit.source: To install the Microsoft Rights Management sharing application, do the following:
trans-unit.target: To install the Microsoft Rights Management sharing application, do the following:

trans-unit.source: Go to the <link><linkText>Microsoft Rights Management</linkText><title></title></link> page on the Microsoft website.
trans-unit.target: Go to the <link><linkText>Microsoft Rights Management</linkText><title></title></link> page on the Microsoft website.

trans-unit.source: In the Computers section, click the icon for the RMS app for Windows and save the Microsoft Rights Management sharing application installation package to your computer.
trans-unit.target: In the Computers section, click the icon for the RMS app for Windows and save the Microsoft Rights Management sharing application installation package to your computer.

trans-unit.source: Double click the compressed file that was downloaded, and then double-click setup.exe.
trans-unit.target: Double click the compressed file that was downloaded, and then double-click setup.exe.

trans-unit.source: If you are prompted to continue, click Yes.
trans-unit.target: If you are prompted to continue, click Yes.

trans-unit.source: On the Setup Microsoft RMS page, click Next, and wait for the installation to finish.
trans-unit.target: On the Setup Microsoft RMS page, click Next, and wait for the installation to finish.

trans-unit.source: When the installation finishes, click Restart to restart your computer and complete the installation.
trans-unit.target: When the installation finishes, click Restart to restart your computer and complete the installation.

trans-unit.source: Or, click Close and restart your computer later to complete the installation.
trans-unit.target: Or, click Close and restart your computer later to complete the installation.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Using Microsoft Rights Management sharing application
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Using Microsoft Rights Management sharing application

trans-unit.source: This section covers different ways to use Microsoft Rights Management sharing application:
trans-unit.target: This section covers different ways to use Microsoft Rights Management sharing application:

trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Creating a generic protected (.pfile) file</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Viewing a generic protected (.pfile) file</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Viewing a generic protected (.pfile) file</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Creating a protected text (.ptxt) file
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Creating a protected text (.ptxt) file

trans-unit.source: Microsoft Rights Management sharing application can be used to convert a regular text (.txt) file into a protected (.ptxt) file.
trans-unit.target: Microsoft Rights Management sharing application can be used to convert a regular text (.txt) file into a protected (.ptxt) file.

trans-unit.source: To create a protected text (.ptxt) file
trans-unit.target: To create a protected text (.ptxt) file

trans-unit.source: In File Explorer, right-click in a folder, point to New, and then click Text Document.
trans-unit.target: In File Explorer, right-click in a folder, point to New, and then click Text Document.

trans-unit.source: Rename the file (for example, Sample.txt).
trans-unit.target: Rename the file (for example, Sample.txt).

trans-unit.source: Double-click the file to open it in Notepad.
trans-unit.target: Double-click the file to open it in Notepad.

trans-unit.source: In Notepad, add a few lines of text to the file, such as the following, and then save it:
trans-unit.target: In Notepad, add a few lines of text to the file, such as the following, and then save it:

trans-unit.source: Right-click the file, point to Protect in-place, and select a template from the list.
trans-unit.target: Right-click the file, point to Protect in-place, and select a template from the list.

trans-unit.source: (Note that if this is the first time you have used the tool, you will need to select Company- Protection to initiate download of the templates for your organization.)
trans-unit.target: (Note that if this is the first time you have used the tool, you will need to select Company- Protection to initiate download of the templates for your organization.)

trans-unit.source: On the Microsoft Rights Management sharing application screen, confirm the policy you want to apply, click Apply, and after the file is protected, click Close.
trans-unit.target: On the Microsoft Rights Management sharing application screen, confirm the policy you want to apply, click Apply, and after the file is protected, click Close.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Viewing a protected text (.ptxt) or a protected image file
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Viewing a protected text (.ptxt) or a protected image file

trans-unit.source: To view a protected text (.ptxt) file, in File Explorer, double-click the file (for example, Sample.ptxt).
trans-unit.target: To view a protected text (.ptxt) file, in File Explorer, double-click the file (for example, Sample.ptxt).

trans-unit.source: You may be prompted to authorize the application to obtain rights.
trans-unit.target: You may be prompted to authorize the application to obtain rights.

trans-unit.source: The protection policy appears at the top of the file.
trans-unit.target: The protection policy appears at the top of the file.

trans-unit.source: Protected images can be similarly opened and viewed.
trans-unit.target: Protected images can be similarly opened and viewed.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Creating a generic protected (.pfile) file
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Creating a generic protected (.pfile) file

trans-unit.source: The generic protection (.pfile) file format can be used to offer a generic level of protection for file types that are not directly supported by Microsoft Rights Management sharing application or other applications that provide built-in RMS-type protection.
trans-unit.target: The generic protection (.pfile) file format can be used to offer a generic level of protection for file types that are not directly supported by Microsoft Rights Management sharing application or other applications that provide built-in RMS-type protection.

trans-unit.source: For example, the generic protection file format can protect .vsd files made using Microsoft Visio (which does not currently support built-in protection).
trans-unit.target: For example, the generic protection file format can protect .vsd files made using Microsoft Visio (which does not currently support built-in protection).

trans-unit.source: Files that use general protection are secured only for authentication.
trans-unit.target: Files that use general protection are secured only for authentication.

trans-unit.source: A user who is authorized to use the protected file (.pfile) will be authenticated and the user’s rights and permissions are displayed but cannot be enforced once the file is opened in its original format (for example, once the .vsd file is opened in Visio).
trans-unit.target: A user who is authorized to use the protected file (.pfile) will be authenticated and the user’s rights and permissions are displayed but cannot be enforced once the file is opened in its original format (for example, once the .vsd file is opened in Visio).

trans-unit.source: A user who is not authorized or cannot be authenticated will not be able to open the protected file.
trans-unit.target: A user who is not authorized or cannot be authenticated will not be able to open the protected file.

trans-unit.source: To create a generic protected file (.pfile) from a Visio drawing (.vsd) file
trans-unit.target: To create a generic protected file (.pfile) from a Visio drawing (.vsd) file

trans-unit.source: In File Explorer, right-click in a folder, point to New, and then click New Visio Document.
trans-unit.target: In File Explorer, right-click in a folder, point to New, and then click New Visio Document.

trans-unit.source: Rename the file (for example, Sample.vsd).
trans-unit.target: Rename the file (for example, Sample.vsd).

trans-unit.source: Double-click the file to open it in Visio.
trans-unit.target: Double-click the file to open it in Visio.

trans-unit.source: In Visio, add elements to the drawing, and then save and close the file.
trans-unit.target: In Visio, add elements to the drawing, and then save and close the file.

trans-unit.source: Right-click the file, point to Protect in-place, and select a policy template from the list.
trans-unit.target: Right-click the file, point to Protect in-place, and select a policy template from the list.

trans-unit.source: (Note that if this is the first time you have used the tool, you will need to select Company- Protection to initiate download of the templates for your organization.)
trans-unit.target: (Note that if this is the first time you have used the tool, you will need to select Company- Protection to initiate download of the templates for your organization.)

trans-unit.source: On the Microsoft Rights Management sharing application screen, select the policy you want to apply, and then click Apply.
trans-unit.target: On the Microsoft Rights Management sharing application screen, select the policy you want to apply, and then click Apply.

trans-unit.source: A message states your protected file was saved as Sample.vsd.pfile (the original file is deleted).
trans-unit.target: A message states your protected file was saved as Sample.vsd.pfile (the original file is deleted).

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Viewing a generic protected (.pfile) file
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Viewing a generic protected (.pfile) file

trans-unit.source: To view a generic protected (.pfile) file, in File Explorer, double-click the generic protected (.pfile) file (for example, Sample.vsd.pfile), and click Open.
trans-unit.target: To view a generic protected (.pfile) file, in File Explorer, double-click the generic protected (.pfile) file (for example, Sample.vsd.pfile), and click Open.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Removing protection from a file
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Removing protection from a file

trans-unit.source: Microsoft Rights Management sharing application gives you the option to remove protection from files that you have previously protected.
trans-unit.target: Microsoft Rights Management sharing application gives you the option to remove protection from files that you have previously protected.

trans-unit.source: To remove protection (that is, unprotect) a file previously protected, you apply the Remove Protection option, as follows:
trans-unit.target: To remove protection (that is, unprotect) a file previously protected, you apply the Remove Protection option, as follows:

trans-unit.source: Right-click Sample.ptxt, point to Protect in-place, and click Remove Protection.
trans-unit.target: Right-click Sample.ptxt, point to Protect in-place, and click Remove Protection.

trans-unit.source: You may be prompted to authorize the application to obtain rights.
trans-unit.target: You may be prompted to authorize the application to obtain rights.

trans-unit.source: Sample.ptxt will be deleted, and replaced with Sample.txt.
trans-unit.target: Sample.ptxt will be deleted, and replaced with Sample.txt.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Using User-Authored Permissions and Sharing Protected Content
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Using User-Authored Permissions and Sharing Protected Content

trans-unit.source: This section covers how to protect and consume a file using user-authored permissions, how to share protected content, and how to protect multiple files:
trans-unit.target: This section covers how to protect and consume a file using user-authored permissions, how to share protected content, and how to protect multiple files:

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Protecting a file with user-authored permissions</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Protecting a file with user-authored permissions</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Consuming files that have user-authored protection</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Sharing protected content</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Sharing protected content</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Using keyboard shortcuts</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Applying protection to multiple files and folders</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Protecting a file with user-authored permissions
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Protecting a file with user-authored permissions

trans-unit.source: User-authored protection can be used to achieve the following:
trans-unit.target: User-authored protection can be used to achieve the following:

trans-unit.source: To limit file access to only a specific list of individual users identified by their email addresses.
trans-unit.target: To limit file access to only a specific list of individual users identified by their email addresses.

trans-unit.source: To limit the use of the file to only specific rights, such as read-only rights to a document.
trans-unit.target: To limit the use of the file to only specific rights, such as read-only rights to a document.

trans-unit.source: To protect a file with user-authored permissions, right-click the file, click Protect in-place and click Custom Permissions.
trans-unit.target: To protect a file with user-authored permissions, right-click the file, click Protect in-place and click Custom Permissions.

trans-unit.source: The following screen will launch:
trans-unit.target: The following screen will launch:

trans-unit.source: Type the email addresses of the list of users, use the slider to select permissions for the file, and click Apply.
trans-unit.target: Type the email addresses of the list of users, use the slider to select permissions for the file, and click Apply.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Consuming files that have user-authored protection
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Consuming files that have user-authored protection

trans-unit.source: Most protected files that are handled by Microsoft Rights Management sharing application will have been protected by applying template-based levels of protection.
trans-unit.target: Most protected files that are handled by Microsoft Rights Management sharing application will have been protected by applying template-based levels of protection.

trans-unit.source: It is possible, however, for Microsoft Rights Management sharing application to also support files that have been given a user-authored level of protection.
trans-unit.target: It is possible, however, for Microsoft Rights Management sharing application to also support files that have been given a user-authored level of protection.

trans-unit.source: User-authored protection can be used to achieve the following types of protection for a file:
trans-unit.target: User-authored protection can be used to achieve the following types of protection for a file:

trans-unit.source: To limit file access to only a very specific list of individual users identified by their email addresses.
trans-unit.target: To limit file access to only a very specific list of individual users identified by their email addresses.

trans-unit.source: To limit the use of the file to only a single specific right such as print-only rights to the document.
trans-unit.target: To limit the use of the file to only a single specific right such as print-only rights to the document.

trans-unit.source: For text and image file formats, this level of protection requires that any applications that are used to edit, save or restrict text or image files have been designed to support RMS protection and implement the protection APIs provided in the AD RMS SDK.
trans-unit.target: For text and image file formats, this level of protection requires that any applications that are used to edit, save or restrict text or image files have been designed to support RMS protection and implement the protection APIs provided in the AD RMS SDK.

trans-unit.source: When viewing a protected text file that has had user- protection applied to it, you will notice a slight difference in the permissions as they are displayed for the file as shown in the following sample.
trans-unit.target: When viewing a protected text file that has had user- protection applied to it, you will notice a slight difference in the permissions as they are displayed for the file as shown in the following sample.

trans-unit.source: For files that are protected using the generic protection (.pfile) file format, the specific rights or permissions that were by the user appear in the confirmation screen instead of the name of the template that was used to protect the file, as shown in the following figure.
trans-unit.target: For files that are protected using the generic protection (.pfile) file format, the specific rights or permissions that were by the user appear in the confirmation screen instead of the name of the template that was used to protect the file, as shown in the following figure.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Sharing protected content
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Sharing protected content

trans-unit.source: To protect and share content, right-click the file, and click Share Protected.
trans-unit.target: To protect and share content, right-click the file, and click Share Protected.

trans-unit.source: The following screen will launch:
trans-unit.target: The following screen will launch:

trans-unit.source: Type the email addresses of the list of users, use the slider to select permissions for the file, and click Send.
trans-unit.target: Type the email addresses of the list of users, use the slider to select permissions for the file, and click Send.

trans-unit.source: The application will launch Outlook with a pre- email, with the protected file attached.
trans-unit.target: The application will launch Outlook with a pre- email, with the protected file attached.

trans-unit.source: The original file will not be protected.
trans-unit.target: The original file will not be protected.

trans-unit.source: To enable users to view protected files on non-Windows devices, click Allow consumption on all devices.
trans-unit.target: To enable users to view protected files on non-Windows devices, click Allow consumption on all devices.

trans-unit.source: Users will need to <link><linkText>download the Microsoft Rights Management sharing application</linkText><title></title></link> for their device.
trans-unit.target: Users will need to <link><linkText>download the Microsoft Rights Management sharing application</linkText><title></title></link> for their device.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Using keyboard shortcuts
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Using keyboard shortcuts

trans-unit.source: Press the Alt key to see the available access keys.
trans-unit.target: Press the Alt key to see the available access keys.

trans-unit.source: Press Alt + the access key to select an option.
trans-unit.target: Press Alt + the access key to select an option.

trans-unit.source: For example, on the Share Protected dialog, press Alt to see the access keys and press Alt + u to select Users must login every time they open this file.
trans-unit.target: For example, on the Share Protected dialog, press Alt to see the access keys and press Alt + u to select Users must login every time they open this file.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Applying protection to multiple files and folders
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Applying protection to multiple files and folders

trans-unit.source: Microsoft Rights Management sharing application can also be used to apply protection to more than a single file, such as by selecting multiple files or a folder that contains unprotected files in File Explorer.
trans-unit.target: Microsoft Rights Management sharing application can also be used to apply protection to more than a single file, such as by selecting multiple files or a folder that contains unprotected files in File Explorer.

trans-unit.source: To protect multiple files or all files within a selected folder
trans-unit.target: To protect multiple files or all files within a selected folder

trans-unit.source: In File Explorer, either select multiple files or select a folder containing multiple files to be protected.
trans-unit.target: In File Explorer, either select multiple files or select a folder containing multiple files to be protected.

trans-unit.source: Right-click the selected folder or files, point to Protect in-place, and select a template from the list.
trans-unit.target: Right-click the selected folder or files, point to Protect in-place, and select a template from the list.

trans-unit.source: (Note that if this is the first time you have used the tool, you will need to select Company- Protection to initiate download of the templates for your organization.)
trans-unit.target: (Note that if this is the first time you have used the tool, you will need to select Company- Protection to initiate download of the templates for your organization.)

trans-unit.source: On the Microsoft Rights Management sharing application screen, confirm the files have been protected.
trans-unit.target: On the Microsoft Rights Management sharing application screen, confirm the files have been protected.

trans-unit.source: If you have errors, refer to <link><linkText>FAQ for Microsoft Rights Management Sharing Application for Windows</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: If you have errors, refer to <link><linkText>FAQ for Microsoft Rights Management Sharing Application for Windows</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Using the Office Toolbar Add-in
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Using the Office Toolbar Add-in

trans-unit.source: You can protect and share Word, PowerPoint, Excel files right from within Microsoft Office by using the Office ribbon add-in for Microsoft Rights Management sharing application.
trans-unit.target: You can protect and share Word, PowerPoint, Excel files right from within Microsoft Office by using the Office ribbon add-in for Microsoft Rights Management sharing application.

trans-unit.source: Click Share Protected on the ribbon to start the Microsoft Rights Management sharing application.
trans-unit.target: Click Share Protected on the ribbon to start the Microsoft Rights Management sharing application.

trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Administrator’s guidance for Microsoft Rights Management sharing application

trans-unit.target: The Administrator's Guide for Microsoft Rights Management sharing application includes the following sections:

trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Microsoft Rights Management sharing application Technical Overview</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Supported File Types</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Microsoft Rights Management sharing application Technical Overview
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Microsoft Rights Management sharing application Technical Overview

trans-unit.source: The Microsoft Rights Management sharing application is an optional downloadable application for Microsoft Windows and other platforms that provides the following:
trans-unit.target: The Microsoft Rights Management sharing application is an optional downloadable application for Microsoft Windows and other platforms that provides the following:

trans-unit.source: Protection of a single file or bulk protection of multiple files as well as all files within a selected folder.
trans-unit.target: Protection of a single file or bulk protection of multiple files as well as all files within a selected folder.

trans-unit.source: Full support for protection of any type of file and a built-in viewer for commonly used text and image file types.
trans-unit.target: Full support for protection of any type of file and a built-in viewer for commonly used text and image file types.

trans-unit.source: Generic protection for files that do not support RMS protection.
trans-unit.target: Generic protection for files that do not support RMS protection.

trans-unit.source: Full interoperability with files protected using Office Information Rights Management (IRM)
trans-unit.target: Full interoperability with files protected using Office Information Rights Management (IRM)

trans-unit.source: Full interoperability with PDF files protected using SharePoint, FCI, and supported PDF authoring tools
trans-unit.target: Full interoperability with PDF files protected using SharePoint, FCI, and supported PDF authoring tools

trans-unit.source: The Microsoft Rights Management sharing application uses the new <link><linkText>AD RMS Client 2.1 runtime</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: The Microsoft Rights Management sharing application uses the new <link><linkText>AD RMS Client 2.1 runtime</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: It provides users the ability to protect content using pre-defined or user-defined templates that you can customize and deploy for your organization.
trans-unit.target: It provides users the ability to protect content using pre-defined or user-defined templates that you can customize and deploy for your organization.

trans-unit.source: By using the functionality of AD RMS 2.1, the Microsoft Rights Management sharing application provides end users a simple protection and consumption experience.
trans-unit.target: By using the functionality of AD RMS 2.1, the Microsoft Rights Management sharing application provides end users a simple protection and consumption experience.

trans-unit.source: With the October 2013 release of Windows Azure AD RMS, you can natively protect documents by using Office 2010 and send them to people in another company, who can then consume them by using Windows Azure AD RMS.
trans-unit.target: With the October 2013 release of Windows Azure AD RMS, you can natively protect documents by using Office 2010 and send them to people in another company, who can then consume them by using Windows Azure AD RMS.

trans-unit.source: In addition, with this release, if you use AD RMS in Cryptographic Mode 2, you can use RMS for individuals and consume content from people in another company that uses Windows Azure AD RMS.
trans-unit.target: In addition, with this release, if you use AD RMS in Cryptographic Mode 2, you can use RMS for individuals and consume content from people in another company that uses Windows Azure AD RMS.

trans-unit.source: For more information about Cryptographic Mode 2, see <link><linkText>AD RMS Cryptographic Modes</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about Cryptographic Mode 2, see <link><linkText>AD RMS Cryptographic Modes</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: To download Microsoft Rights Management sharing application, do the following:
trans-unit.target: To download Microsoft Rights Management sharing application, do the following:

trans-unit.source: Sign in to <link><linkText>Microsoft Connect</linkText><title></title></link> with your Microsoft Account (formerly known as Live ID).
trans-unit.target: Sign in to <link><linkText>Microsoft Connect</linkText><title></title></link> with your Microsoft Account (formerly known as Live ID).

trans-unit.source: On the Home page, search for Rights Management Services and join the group.
trans-unit.target: On the Home page, search for Rights Management Services and join the group.

trans-unit.source: Click Downloads, and then click Microsoft Rights Management sharing application.
trans-unit.target: Click Downloads, and then click Microsoft Rights Management sharing application.

trans-unit.source: On the Download Details page, select Microsoft Rights Management sharing application.zip and click Download.
trans-unit.target: On the Download Details page, select Microsoft Rights Management sharing application.zip and click Download.

trans-unit.source: If necessary, install Microsoft File Transfer Manager and complete the steps to download Microsoft Rights Management sharing application.
trans-unit.target: If necessary, install Microsoft File Transfer Manager and complete the steps to download Microsoft Rights Management sharing application.

trans-unit.source: Levels of Protection Supported by Microsoft Rights Management sharing application
trans-unit.target: Levels of Protection Supported by Microsoft Rights Management sharing application

trans-unit.source: Microsoft Rights Management sharing application supports protection at two different levels, as described in the following table.
trans-unit.target: Microsoft Rights Management sharing application supports protection at two different levels, as described in the following table.

trans-unit.source: Type of protection
trans-unit.target: Type of protection

trans-unit.source: Native
trans-unit.target: Native

trans-unit.source: Generic
trans-unit.target: Generic

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: For text, image, Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) files, .pdf files, and other application file types that support AD RMS, native protection provides a strong level of protection that includes both encryption and enforcement of rights (permissions).
trans-unit.target: For text, image, Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) files, .pdf files, and other application file types that support AD RMS, native protection provides a strong level of protection that includes both encryption and enforcement of rights (permissions).

trans-unit.source: For all other applications and file types, generic protection provides a level of protection that includes both file encapsulation using the .pfile file type and authentication to verify if a user is authorized to open the file.
trans-unit.target: For all other applications and file types, generic protection provides a level of protection that includes both file encapsulation using the .pfile file type and authentication to verify if a user is authorized to open the file.

trans-unit.source: Protection
trans-unit.target: Protection

trans-unit.source: Files are fully encrypted and protection is enforced in the following ways:<html></html><html></html>- Before protected content is rendered, successful authentication must occur for those who receive the file through email or are given access to it through file or share permissions.<html></html>- Additionally, usage rights and policy set by the content owner when files are protected are fully enforced when the content is rendered in either IP Viewer (for protected text and image files) or the associated application (for all other supported file types).
trans-unit.target: Files are fully encrypted and protection is enforced in the following ways:<html></html><html></html>- Before protected content is rendered, successful authentication must occur for those who receive the file through email or are given access to it through file or share permissions.<html></html>- Additionally, usage rights and policy set by the content owner when files are protected are fully enforced when the content is rendered in either IP Viewer (for protected text and image files) or the associated application (for all other supported file types).

trans-unit.source: File protection is enforced in the following ways:<html></html><html></html>- Before protected content is rendered, successful authentication must occur for those who are authorized to open the file and given access to it.
trans-unit.target: File protection is enforced in the following ways:<html></html><html></html>- Before protected content is rendered, successful authentication must occur for those who are authorized to open the file and given access to it.

trans-unit.source: If authorization fails, the file does not open.<html></html>- Usage rights and policy set by the content owner are displayed to inform authorized users of the intended usage policy.<html></html>- Audit logging of authorized users opening and accessing files occurs, however, no usage rights are enforced by non-supporting applications.
trans-unit.target: If authorization fails, the file does not open.<html></html>- Usage rights and policy set by the content owner are displayed to inform authorized users of the intended usage policy.<html></html>- Audit logging of authorized users opening and accessing files occurs, however, no usage rights are enforced by non-supporting applications.

trans-unit.source: Default for file types
trans-unit.target: Default for file types

trans-unit.source: This is the default level of protection for the following file types:<html></html><html></html>- Text and image files<html></html>- Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) files<html></html>- Portable document format (.pdf)<html></html><html></html>For more information, see Supported File Types.
trans-unit.target: This is the default level of protection for the following file types:<html></html><html></html>- Text and image files<html></html>- Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) files<html></html>- Portable document format (.pdf)<html></html><html></html>For more information, see Supported File Types.

trans-unit.source: This is the default protection for all other file types (such as .vsdx, .rtf, and so on) not supported through full protection.
trans-unit.target: This is the default protection for all other file types (such as .vsdx, .rtf, and so on) not supported through full protection.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Automatic deployment for the Microsoft Rights Management sharing application
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Automatic deployment for the Microsoft Rights Management sharing application

trans-unit.source: The Windows version of the RMS sharing application supports a scripted installation, which makes it suitable for enterprise deployments.
trans-unit.target: The Windows version of the RMS sharing application supports a scripted installation, which makes it suitable for enterprise deployments.

trans-unit.source: To download the RMS sharing application for automatic deployment
trans-unit.target: To download the RMS sharing application for automatic deployment

trans-unit.source: Go to the Microsoft Rights Management sharing application for Windows page in the Microsoft Download Center, and click Download.
trans-unit.target: Go to the Microsoft Rights Management sharing application for Windows page in the Microsoft Download Center, and click Download.

trans-unit.source: Select and download the files that you need.
trans-unit.target: Select and download the files that you need.

trans-unit.source: There are two client installation packages: one for Windows 64-bit (Microsoft Rights Management sharing application x64.zip), and another for Windows 32-bit (Microsoft Rights Management sharing application x86.zip).
trans-unit.target: There are two client installation packages: one for Windows 64-bit (Microsoft Rights Management sharing application x64.zip), and another for Windows 32-bit (Microsoft Rights Management sharing application x86.zip).

trans-unit.source: Extract the files from the compressed installation packages, for example, by double-clicking them.
trans-unit.target: Extract the files from the compressed installation packages, for example, by double-clicking them.

trans-unit.source: Then copy the extracted files to a network location that client computers can access.
trans-unit.target: Then copy the extracted files to a network location that client computers can access.

trans-unit.source: For the Office 2010 and Windows Azure RMS scenario, you might be using Windows Azure RMS, or you might be using Active Directory RMS but want to securely send documents to people in another company who use Windows Azure RMS.
trans-unit.target: For the Office 2010 and Windows Azure RMS scenario, you might be using Windows Azure RMS, or you might be using Active Directory RMS but want to securely send documents to people in another company who use Windows Azure RMS.

trans-unit.source: When you install and run the Windows Azure Active Directory Rights Management preparation tool to support Office 2010, it does two things:
trans-unit.target: When you install and run the Windows Azure Active Directory Rights Management preparation tool to support Office 2010, it does two things:

trans-unit.source: - It edits the registry to support the RMS sharing application.
trans-unit.target: - It edits the registry to support the RMS sharing application.

trans-unit.source: - It “bootstraps” the user, which means the computer contacts the AD RMS server or Windows Azure RMS and obtains the certificates that the computer and user need to use RMS.
trans-unit.target: - It “bootstraps” the user, which means the computer contacts the AD RMS server or Windows Azure RMS and obtains the certificates that the computer and user need to use RMS.

trans-unit.target: Office 2013 and Windows Azure RMS

trans-unit.target: Office 2010 and Windows Azure RMS

trans-unit.source: Upgrade the RMS sharing application
trans-unit.target: Upgrade the RMS sharing application

trans-unit.source: The examples in the commands assume that you have copied the downloaded and extracted files to a network share that client computers access by using \\server5\apps\rms and that the client computers already have a folder named C:\Log files where you store application installation log files.
trans-unit.target: The examples in the commands assume that you have copied the downloaded and extracted files to a network share that client computers access by using \\server5\apps\rms and that the client computers already have a folder named C:\Log files where you store application installation log files.

trans-unit.source: For each installation, you choose the name of the installation log file, but it must have a .log file extension.
trans-unit.target: For each installation, you choose the name of the installation log file, but it must have a .log file extension.

trans-unit.source: Before you deploy the RMS sharing application, you must package the required commands in these procedures so that they can install in the machine context for all users, and install with local administrator privileges.
trans-unit.target: Before you deploy the RMS sharing application, you must package the required commands in these procedures so that they can install in the machine context for all users, and install with local administrator privileges.

trans-unit.source: You can then deploy the package to computers by using your standard application deployment mechanism, such as Group Policy, or System Center Configuration Manager.
trans-unit.target: You can then deploy the package to computers by using your standard application deployment mechanism, such as Group Policy, or System Center Configuration Manager.

trans-unit.source: The exception is the Windows Azure Active Directory Rights Management preparation tool: This must run once for each user on the computer, and the tool must run with elevated privileges to successfully edit the registry.
trans-unit.target: The exception is the Windows Azure Active Directory Rights Management preparation tool: This must run once for each user on the computer, and the tool must run with elevated privileges to successfully edit the registry.

trans-unit.source: There are different ways to achieve this, including asking users to run the command (for example, a link in an email message or a link on the help desk portal) or you can add it to their logon script.
trans-unit.target: There are different ways to achieve this, including asking users to run the command (for example, a link in an email message or a link on the help desk portal) or you can add it to their logon script.

trans-unit.source: If you cannot use the runas command because users do not have a local administrator account, there are deployment tools that can automatically elevate a command, according to rules that you specify.
trans-unit.target: If you cannot use the runas command because users do not have a local administrator account, there are deployment tools that can automatically elevate a command, according to rules that you specify.

trans-unit.source: To deploy the RMS sharing application for Office 2013 and Windows Azure RMS
trans-unit.target: To deploy the RMS sharing application for Office 2013 and Windows Azure RMS

trans-unit.source: Install the AD RMS Client and the RMS sharing application by using the following commands:
trans-unit.target: Install the AD RMS Client and the RMS sharing application by using the following commands:

trans-unit.source: For 64-bit Windows: x64\setup_ipviewer.exe /norestart /quiet /msicl "MSIRESTARTMANAGERCONTROL=Disable" /log "<log file path and name>"
trans-unit.target: For 64-bit Windows: x64\setup_ipviewer.exe /norestart /quiet /msicl "MSIRESTARTMANAGERCONTROL=Disable" /log "<log file path and name>"

trans-unit.source: For 32-bit Windows:
trans-unit.target: For 32-bit Windows:

trans-unit.source: For example: \\server5\apps\rms\x64\setup_ipviewer.exe /norestart /quiet /msicl "MSIRESTARTMANAGERCONTROL=Disable" /log "C:\Log files\ipviewerinstall.log"
trans-unit.target: For example: \\server5\apps\rms\x64\setup_ipviewer.exe /norestart /quiet /msicl "MSIRESTARTMANAGERCONTROL=Disable" /log "C:\Log files\ipviewerinstall.log"
